Home ELECTIONS ELECTIONS Saint Hedwig General Election May 2, 2026 to elect Mayor, City Council Place 2 and City Council Place 4 Notice of Deadline to File an Application for Place on the Ballot It is the candidate's responsibility to ensure the required, proper and applicable applications/forms/documents/reports are completed and filed in a timely manner. All documents requiring a notary should be notarized before filing with the City. First Steps for Candidates Running for a City Office (1/1/2026) (Texas Ethics Commission, TEC) Application for a Place on the Ballot Form CTA, Appointment of Campaign Treasurer (1/1/2026) Form CTA, Instruction Guide (1/1/2026) Request for Confidentiality of Candidate (09/2025) FAIR CAMPAIGN PRACTICES Fair Campaign Practices Act (Texas Election Code, Chapter 258) Form CFCP, Code for Fair Campaign Practices (Voluntary) CAMPAIGN FINANCE (Reference Texas Ethics Commission website, https://ethics.state.tx.us ) Campaign Finance Guide for Candidates (1/1/2026) (Texas Ethics Commission, TEC) Texas Ethics Commission 2026 Filing Schedule for Reports Form C/OH, Campaign Finance Report (1/1/2025) Form C/OH, Instruction Guide (1/1/2025) Form UD, Unsworn Declaration to Campaign Finance Report Reporting Requirements for Credit Card Expenditures Form ACTA, Amendment: Appointment of a Campaign Treasurer (1/1/2025) Form ACTA, Instruction Guide (1/1/2025) POLITICAL ADVERTISING Political Advertising, What You Need to Know (TEC) Saint Hedwig Sign Ordinance 2025-03 Texas Department of Transportation (TXDOT)_Campaign Signs TXDOT_Political & Campaign Signs_Frequently Asked Questions THE CITY OF SAINT HEDWIG DOES NOT PROVIDE LEGAL OR CAMPAIGN ADVISE. For legal or campaign advise, contact the Texas Ethics Commission or the Texas Secretary of State. Texas Ethics Commission 1-512-463-5800 https://ethics.state.tx.us/ Texas Secretary of State 1-800-252-8683 https://www.sos.state.tx.us/elections/index.shtml The City of Saint Hedwig contracts with Bexar County to administer its elections. Unofficial Election Results are provided by Bexar County Elections Dept. on Election night. Bexar County Elections Dept. - Election Results The City of Saint Hedwig holds its General Election  every year on the first Saturday of May. Election is held at: Saint Hedwig City Hall 13065 FM 1346 Saint Hedwig, Texas 78152 210-667-9568 cityhall@sainthedwigcity.com The office of Mayor and City Council Place 2 and Place 4 are up for election on even numbered years. The office of City Council Place 1, Place 3 and Place 5 are up for election on odd numbered years. All elected officials serve two-year terms. Candidates must meet the following qualifications per Type A City, Local Gov't Code, Section 22.032,  and other eligibility requirements of the Texas Election Code and Local Government Code. For Office of Mayor:
  • One (1) year in the State of Texas prior to filing deadline and
  • One (1) year in the City of Saint Hedwig (within the city limits) prior to election day.
For Office of City Council:
  • One (1) year in the State of Texas prior to filing deadline and
  • Six (6) months in the City of Saint Hedwig (within the city limits) prior to election day.
Candidate must be minimum 18 years of age. Candidate must be a registered voter in the territory elected from by the filing deadline. First day to file an application for a place on the ballot: 30th day before the filing deadline. Last day (filing deadline) to file an application for a place on the ballot: 78th day before election day, 5:00 p.m.
  • TEXAS SECRETARY OF STATE - CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS
